alert.note: Alert for Coastal Collier County; Hendry; Inland Broward County; Inland Collier County; Inland Miami-Dade County; Mainland Monroe (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 26 at 3:52PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Collier, southeastern Hendry and far western Broward Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 351 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking strong thunderstorms capable of producing a landspout along a line extending from 7 miles southwest of Big Cypress Seminole Reservation to 8 miles east of Copeland to 7 miles southeast of Royal Palm Hammock. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Chokoloskee, Everglades City, Plantation Island, Carnestown, Miccosukee Service Plaza, Copeland, Big Cypress Seminole Reservation, Big Cypress National Preserve, Miccosukee Indian Reservation, Royal Palm Hammock, South Blocks Golde, Fakahatchee Strand State Preserve, Picayune Strand State Forest, Port Of The Island, Miles City, Cape Romano Aquatic Preserve, Jerome and Deep Lake. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE LIGHTNING...EXCESSIVE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Move indoors and stay away from windows. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Persons participating in outdoor activities should seek sturdy shelter until these storms pass. Open shelters found in parks, beaches, or golf courses offer no protection from the dangers of lightning.
